He had never learned how to repair wounds, and now he came to think of it – particularly in
en_second_half: light of his immediate plans – this seemed a serious flaw in his magical education. Making a mental note to ask Hermione how it was done, he used a large wad of toilet paper to mop up as much of the tea as he could before returning to his bedroom and slamming the door behind him.
en_results: the heat of the moment, when his mind was focused on more pressing matters – he had never really considered the importance of such a skill. It was a gaping hole in his magical education, and one that he couldn't help but feel a little embarrassed about. After all, what kind of wizard
en_results_raw: the heat of the moment, when his mind was focused on more pressing matters – he had never really considered the importance of such a skill. It was a gaping hole in his magical education, and one that he couldn't help but feel a little embarrassed about. After all, what kind of wizard couldn't even heal a simple cut? He thought back to his time at the academy, wondering how he had managed to overlook such a fundamental aspect of magic. Had he been too focused on more complex spells? Had he simply assumed that he would never need to know how to repair wounds? Whatever the reason, he knew that he had to learn this skill, and fast. He couldn't very well go around with a gaping cut in his finger, relying on others to heal him. That would be a blow to his pride, not to mention a serious liability in his line of work. He made a mental note to seek out a tutor, or perhaps a book on the subject, as soon as possible. In the meantime, he would just have to suffer through the pain and inconvenience of his injury. He gritted his teeth and set to work, trying to come up with a makeshift bandage to cover the cut until he could get it properly healed.

The motorbike wove in and out of the trees, the tires screeching in protest as they took the sharp turns, and Harry's stomach lurched with the motion. He held on for dear life, his knuckles white with tension, as the motorbike hurtled through the darkness, the only sound the roar of the engine and the rush of the wind. Suddenly, the motorbike skidded to a stop, and Harry was thrown forward, his chest slamming into the back of the rider. The rider turned, and Harry saw that it was Sirius, a look of grim determination etched on his face. "Hold on, Harry," he shouted above the din of the engine, "we're not out of this yet!"

He saw a collection of old photographs on a nearby shelf, showing Sirius as a young man, smiling and carefree, with a group of friends Harry didn't recognize. There was also a large, ornate mirror hanging on one wall, its surface cloudy with age. Harry approached the desk, his wand still casting a warm glow over the room. He saw a piece of parchment lying on the desk, with a few scribbled notes in Sirius's handwriting. The words were faint, but Harry's eyes widened as he read the message, his heart racing with a mix of emotions. He felt a lump form in his throat as he realized the significance of what he was reading. Suddenly, he heard a faint creaking sound coming from the wardrobe, and he spun around, his wand at the ready.

es_first_half: Siguió subiendo la escalera hasta el último rellano, donde sólo había dos puertas. En la que tenía delante había una placa que rezaba «Sirius»; nunca había entrado en el dormitorio de su padrino. Empujó la puerta y mantuvo la varita en alto para que la luz llegara lo más lejos posible. La habitación era amplia, y en otros tiempos debía de haber sido bonita. Había una cama muy ancha con cabecera de madera labrada, una
es_second_half: alta ventana tapada con largas cortinas de terciopelo y una araña de luces cubierta de polvo, en cuyos soportes todavía quedaban cabos de vela de los que colgaban gotas de cera reseca. Una fina capa de polvo cubría también los cuadros de las paredes y la cabecera de la cama, y una telaraña se extendía desde la lámpara hasta lo alto del gran armario. Al entrar en la habitación, oyó un correteo de ratones asustados.
es_results: alfombra roja que cubría casi todo el suelo, un gran escritorio de madera oscura y una chimenea de piedra tallada. Sin embargo, ahora todo parecía desgastado y sucio. La cama estaba deshecha, la alfombra estaba llena de polvo y había una capa de grasa en el escritorio. La chimenea estaba llena de cenizas frías y había un olor a humo rancio en el aire. Harry se sintió un poco incómodo al ver el estado en que se encontraba
es_results_raw: alfombra roja que cubría casi todo el suelo, un gran escritorio de madera oscura y una chimenea de piedra tallada. Sin embargo, ahora todo parecía desgastado y sucio. La cama estaba deshecha, la alfombra estaba llena de polvo y había una capa de grasa en el escritorio. La chimenea estaba llena de cenizas frías y había un olor a humo rancio en el aire. Harry se sintió un poco incómodo al ver el estado en que se encontraba la habitación de su padrino. Se acercó a la cama y vio que había una foto en la mesita de noche. Era una foto de su madre y su padre, sonriendo y abrazados. Harry se sintió un poco triste al ver la foto, pero también se sintió agradecido de que su padrino la hubiera conservado. Siguió mirando alrededor de la habitación y vio un libro en el escritorio. Era un libro de hechizos, y parecía que había sido utilizado recientemente. Harry se sintió un poco curioso y se acercó al escritorio para examinar el libro más de cerca. Mientras lo hojeaba, se dio cuenta de que había una nota en la última página. La nota estaba escrita en una letra que Harry no reconoció, pero parecía ser un mensaje de su padrino. Decía: "Para Harry, si estás leyendo esto, es que ya no estoy. Espero que hayas encontrado lo que estabas buscando. Recuerda que siempre estaré contigo, en espíritu". Harry se sintió un poco conmovido al leer la nota, y se dio cuenta de que su padrino había estado preparándose para su muerte durante mucho tiempo. Se sintió agradecido de que su padrino hubiera pensado en él, y se comprometió a seguir adelante con su misión, no importa lo que sucediera.

Harry sonrió y se sentó en el suelo, invitando a los duendes a hacer lo mismo. "Queremos saber qué está pasando en Hogwarts", dijo. "Hemos oído rumores de que algo extraño está sucediendo en el castillo. ¿Sabéis algo al respecto?"

His stomach growled with hunger, reminding him of his mission, and he quickened his pace, his eyes scanning the ground for any signs of edible plants or small game. As he walked, the silence was broken only by the soft rustling of leaves and the distant hooting of an owl, and Harry felt a sense of peace wash over him, a sense of being connected to the natural world that he rarely experienced in the hustle and bustle of Hogwarts. Suddenly, he caught sight of a small clearing up ahead, and his heart skipped a beat as he spotted a small rabbit nibbling on a particularly succulent-looking clover. With a swift and silent movement, Harry reached out with his wand and cast a gentle Stunning Spell, and the rabbit froze, motionless, as Harry crept forward to claim his prize.

en_results_raw: given up trying to understand the strange occurrences that had been plaguing the school, and I hoped that the Cloak might hold some answers. James, ever the trusting friend, handed it over to me without hesitation. I spent hours poring over the intricate patterns and symbols etched into its surface, trying to decipher their meaning. And then, on the night of the tragedy, I had been so caught up in my research that I had forgotten to return the Cloak to James. It was still clutched in my hand when I stumbled upon the scene of the crime, and in the chaos that followed, it was left behind, a tangible connection to the events that had unfolded. I have often wondered, in the years since, what might have been if I had been more diligent in my studies, if I had unlocked the secrets of the Cloak before it was too late.
